DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Proton Beam Radiation Therapy Administered Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the quantity or dose administered, in centigrays, for proton radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target using a type of external beam radiation therapy that uses a beam of protons and has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Proton Beam Radiation Therapy Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the administration of proton radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target using a type of external beam radiation therapy that uses a beam of protons and has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A type of external beam radiation therapy using a beam of protons.  It has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A type of external beam radiation therapy using a beam of protons. It has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
